intro: Elaphoglossum tambillense, commonly known as the Tambillense holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries such as Colombia and Ecuador. The plant features delicate, bipinnate fronds with a distinctive, upright growth habit. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are typically located on the undersides of the fronds. Elaphoglossum tambillense is often found in shaded, moist forest understories, where it thrives in humid and nutrient-rich environments.
